definition:
Let $K$ be any local field. For any two nonzero elements
$a,b \in K^\times$, we define: $$(a,b) :=
\begin{cases}
+1 & \text{ if $z^2 = ax^2 + by^2$ has a nonzero solution $(x,y,z) \neq (0,0,0)$ in $K^3$,} \\
-1 & \text{ otherwise.}
\end{cases}$$ The number $(a,b)$ is called the [*Hilbert symbol*]{} of
$a$ and $b$ in $K$.
